008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.filter.generic;
010
011import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
012import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * This (abstract) class represents a filter which treats all pixel values 
017 * as scalars. If the processed image has more than one component 
018 * (e.g., a RGB color image), this filter is automatically 
019 * and independently applied to all (scalar-valued) components.
020 * The filter calls the method {@code doPixel(PixelSlice, int, int)}
021 * for each image pixel, which must be implemented by any concrete
022 * sub-class.
023 * </p>
024 * <p>
025 * Thus a custom filter based on this class only needs to specify the steps
026 * to be performed for a single pixel. The remaining filter mechanics
027 * including multiple components, out-of-bounds coordinate handling,
028 * multiple passes and data copying are handled by this class and its super-class
029 * (see {@link GenericFilter}).
030 * </p>
031 */
032public abstract class GenericFilterScalar extends GenericFilter {
033        
034        // for progress reporting only
035        private int slice;
036        private int sliceMax = 1;
037        
038        private int iter;
039        private int iterMax = 1;
040        
041        // apply filter to a stack of pixel slices (1 pass)
042        @Override
043        protected void runPass(PixelPack source, PixelPack target) {
044                sliceMax = source.getDepth();
045                for (int k = 0; k < sliceMax; k++) {
046                        //IJ.log("+++++++ starting slice " + k);
047                        this.slice = k;
048                        runSlice(source.getSlice(k), target.getSlice(k));       // default behavior: apply filter to each plane, place results in target
049                }
050        }
051        
052        // a bit wasteful, as we provide a separate target for each plane
053        private void runSlice(PixelSlice sourcePlane, PixelSlice targetPlane) {
054                final int width = sourcePlane.getWidth();
055                final int height = sourcePlane.getHeight();
056                this.iterMax = width * height;
057                this.iter = 0;
058                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
059                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
060                                targetPlane.setVal(u, v, doPixel(sourcePlane, u, v));
061                                this.iter++;
062                        }
063                }
064                this.iter = 0;
065        }
066
067        // this method every scalar filter must implement
068        // calculate the result value for a single pixel
069        /**
070         * This method defines the steps to be performed for a single image pixel and
071         * must be implemented by any concrete sub-class.
072         * The source data are passed as a {@link PixelSlice} container, which
073         * holds the scalar values of one image component.
074         * The method {@link PixelSlice#getVal(int, int)} should be used to read
075         * individual pixel values. These data should not be modified but
076         * the (float) result of the single-pixel calculation must be returned.
077         * 
078         * @param source the scalar-valued data for a single image component
079         * @param u the current x-position
080         * @param v the current y-position
081         * @return the result of the filter calculation for this pixel
082         */
083        protected abstract float doPixel(PixelSlice source, int u, int v);
084        
085        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
086
087        @Override
088        protected final double reportProgress(double subProgress) {
089                double loopProgress = (this.iter + subProgress) / this.iterMax;
090                //IJ.log("   loopProgress = " + loopProgress);
091                double sliceProgress = (this.slice + loopProgress) / this.sliceMax;
092                //IJ.log("   sliceProgress = " + sliceProgress);
093                //System.out.println("reportProgress: GenericFilterScalar " + localProgress);
094                return super.reportProgress(sliceProgress);
095        }
096
097}
